hanzi-su-wiki:
呪

Значения

Проклинать; заклинать, колдовать

Мнемоника

Удвоение ртов 口 в смысле «крепко выражаться» и уходить 儿 прочь.

Варианты

咒
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhòu
variant of 咒 [zhou4]
вариант проклятия [zhou4]
rtega_mnemonic:
呪呪RScurse, damn, incantation
  • RS. a man 兄 who speaks 口 an incantation
heisig_constituent: curse, mouth, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs, mouth2
heisig_story: For some reason, the inventor of this kanji associated a curse with the mouth of an older brother. I leave it to you to decide if he is on the giving or receiving end of the sorcery.
koohiiStory1: Caution: this means a spell, not to swear. I put a curse on my elder brother so that he can never open his mouth.
koohiiStory2: Your older brother´s mouth often curses.
kunYomi: まじな.う、のろ.い、まじな.い、のろ.う
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: From the mouth of your older brother comes... a curse!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine him cursing you. He's not a fan of you, since you are siblings, but to think he'd go so far as to put a curse on you? You can't believe it. What kind of curse did he put upon you?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Turns out, he put the no road (のろ) curse on you, meaning you can never walk on roads.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: In your mind, walk around the area where you live. Think about the places you can go that aren't roads. If you try to walk on a road, you can't. This is the no road curse, after all.

呪字的基本解释

呪
zhòu
同“咒”。

呪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhòu］
［《廣韻》職救切，去宥，章。］
亦作“咒1”。
(1)祷告；祝告。
(2)诅咒。
(3)旧时道士、方士、神巫等施行法术时的一种口诀。
(4)即梵语陀罗尼。意译为咒或真言。

呪字的康熙字典解释

【丑集上】【口字部】　呪； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页182第02
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?職救切，音䯾。【廣韻】呪詛也。【戰國策】許綰爲我呪。【後漢·王忳傳】忳呪曰：有何枉狀。【關尹子·七釜篇】有誦呪者。　又【集韻】通作祝。【書·無逸】民否，則厥心違怨否，則厥口詛祝。【詩·大雅】侯作侯祝。【周禮·春官】有詛祝。　【集韻】或作詶，亦作詋。

呪字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
呪字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
Gai
zhòu
Same as "curse".
Gai
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhòu］
["Guangyun" job rescue cut, go to you, chapter. ]
Also known as "Curse 1".
(1) Prayer; blessings.
(2) Curse.
(3) A formula used by Taoist priests, alchemists, and witches to perform spells in the old days.
(4) Dharani in Sanskrit. Translated freely as mantra or mantra.
Gai
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chou Ji 1] [Words Department] 　呪; Kangxi strokes: 8; Page number: page 182 02
[Guang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun]? Job rescue cut, sound feign. [Guang Yun] Gu curse too. [Warring States Policy] Xu Wan sighed for me. [Later Han·Wang Yu Chuan] Yu Yu said: What's in vain? [Guan Yinzi·Seven Cauldrons] There are chanters.　[Jiyun] All for wishing. [Book·Wuyi] If the people do not, then the heart will violate the grievances, and the people will curse. [Poetry·Daya] Hou Zuo Hou Zhu. [Zhou Li·Chun Guan] There is a curse.　【Jiyun】Or as 詶, also used as 詋.

Name meaning

zhòu
вм. 咒
Radicals: 口, 兄  (mouth, older-brother)
Meaning Mnemonic
From the mouth of your older brother comes... a curse!
Imagine him cursing you. He's not a fan of you, since you are siblings, but to think he'd go so far as to put a curse on you? You can't believe it. What kind of curse did he put upon you?
Reading Mnemonic
Turns out, he put the no road (のろ) curse on you, meaning you can never walk on roads.
In your mind, walk around the area where you live. Think about the places you can go that aren't roads. If you try to walk on a road, you can't. This is the no road curse, after all.
